00085         /*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00086         /* The following functions must not be called by an application.       */
00087         /* They are the entry point from the stack callback functions into our */
00088         /* object orientated framework (APOXI).                                */
00089         /* They are implemented as static because they have to be passed as    */
00090         /* normal C function pointers. The reason for this is the BT-API Stack */
00091         /* interface that demands C function pointers for callback the         */
00092         /* callback functions it calls to state the progress of ongoing        */
00093         /* operations                                                          */
00094         /*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00095 
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099         //File Push scenarios
00100         // Callback corresponding to BPP_SND_CONNECT_IND msg, BPP_SND_ConnectInd
00101         static void BppSndConnectIndCb (btapi_result_t result, const btapi_bpp_snd_connect_ind_t *ind);
00102         // Callback corresponding to BPP_SND_FILE_PUSH_CFM
00103         static void BppSndFilePushCfmCb(btapi_result_t result, const btapi_bpp_snd_file_push_cfm_t *cfm);
00104         static void BppSndDisconnectIndCb(btapi_result_t result, const btapi_bpp_snd_disconnect_ind_t *ind); 
00105         
00106         //getReferencedObjects Scenarios
00107         static void BppSndGetRefObjIndCb(btapi_result_t result, const btapi_bpp_snd_get_ref_obj_ind_t *ind); 
00108         static void BppSndGetRefObjCompleteIndCb(btapi_result_t result); 
00109         
00110         //Abort Scenarios
00111         static void BppSndAbortCfmCb(btapi_result_t result, const btapi_bpp_snd_abort_cfm_t *cfm); // Callback for Abort Indication (BIP_ABORT_IND) 
00112         
00113         //Obex Authentication
